N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 645-6.12 - Official notice

State Regulations
(a) The
hearing officer or the commission may take official notice of a fact not
subject to reasonable dispute if it is either generally known or can be
accurately and readily verified in generally accepted references prior to or
following the close of the hearing record. (b) If the hearing officer or the commission
intends to take official notice of a material fact not appearing in the hearing
record and of which judicial notice could not be taken, every party shall be
given notice and an opportunity to dispute the fact and its
materiality. Notes
